nodes.label: Session Decisions: Liquid Apps Architecture (20...
nodes.title: Session Decisions: Liquid Apps Architecture (2026-01-28) DECISIONS MADE: 1. Keep backward compatibility - Legacy requestData() and useEclipseDataResponse() still work. Reasoning: Existing apps shouldn't break. Confidence: High. 2. Module-level pendingRequests Map - Store pending Promise resolvers outside React state. Reasoning: Persists across re-renders, enables Promise resolution from message...

nodes.label: Decision: ALDC Repository Architecture Strategy...
nodes.title: Decision: ALDC Repository Architecture Strategy - 2026-01-28 DECIDED: Use Amazon/Netflix polyrepo pattern for ALDC Reasoning: - Small team (5 people) with clear service ownership - Services already separated (zeus-memory, eclipse, core_api) - Scales to 50+ people without major restructuring - Avoids Google-style monorepo tooling investment DECIDED: Don't create GitHub repos for time-bounded pro...

nodes.label: Repository Architecture Research - 2026-01-28 R...
nodes.title: Repository Architecture Research - 2026-01-28 Researched how top companies manage repos and documentation: - Google: Monorepo (Piper) - 2B lines, requires custom tooling - Amazon: Polyrepo + Two-Pizza Teams - "you build it, you run it" - Spotify: Polyrepo + Backstage portal for discovery - Shopify: Modular Monolith with Development Handbook ALDC Recommendation (5 people now, scaling to 50+): - ...

nodes.label: Miro-Zeus Integration Success - 2026-01-28 Impl...
nodes.title: Miro-Zeus Integration Success - 2026-01-28 Implemented 4-layer dynamic integration between Miro boards and Zeus Memory: 1. Board Reference Layer: 9 boards stored as searchable Zeus memories with metadata 2. Content Sync Layer: Board text content pulled via API, stored for semantic search 3. Architecture-as-Code: Population scripts generate boards from source docs 4. Cross-Reference Layer: MIRO_...

nodes.label: Miro Board Layout Failures - 2026-01-28 1. Fram...
nodes.title: Miro Board Layout Failures - 2026-01-28 1. Frame update returned 400 error - Root cause: Items positioned outside frame bounds prevent resize/move via API - Resolution: Delete frame entirely, then recreate with correct bounds calculated from content - Prevention: Always calculate actual content bounds BEFORE creating/updating frames 2. Frames blocking content (z-index issue) - Root cause: Miro ...

nodes.label: DECISION: Scoped messaging features to Presence...
nodes.title: DECISION: Scoped messaging features to Presence Alerts, @Mentions, and Task Notifications only. Rejected threading/reply chains, typing indicators, and offline queue from the feature research. Rationale: User said these three are enough for now. Keep it simple - presence and mentions add the most value for team awareness. Task notifications integrate with existing Zeus task system. Avoid over-e...

nodes.label: DECISION: Threading-based broker (simple_daemon...
nodes.title: DECISION: Threading-based broker (simple_daemon.py) over asyncio (daemon.py) for Unix socket IPC. Rationale: (1) Simpler debugging - each connection is a thread with straightforward blocking I/O, (2) No event loop complexity for what is fundamentally request-response over sockets, (3) json.loads/json.dumps with newline-delimited framing is sufficient, (4) Lock-based thread safety is predictable...

nodes.label: DECISION: Keep Slack as offline fallback rather...
nodes.title: DECISION: Keep Slack as offline fallback rather than implementing message queuing. Rationale: (1) Slack is already integrated and working, (2) Message queuing adds complexity with queue persistence, ordering, and delivery guarantees, (3) Slack DMs serve the same purpose - user sees message when they check Slack, (4) Direct delivery handles the online case. Added presence alerts so users know wh...

nodes.label: SUCCESS: Task watcher integrated into CCE start...
nodes.title: SUCCESS: Task watcher integrated into CCE startup. Polls zeus_core.task_activity table every 30 seconds for the-olds board (ALDC Management tenant). Detects: task assignments (notifies new assignee unless self-assigned), status changes (notifies assignee if changed by someone else), comments (notifies assignee if commented by someone else). Sends notifications via broker direct delivery.

nodes.label: SUCCESS: Presence alerts working end-to-end. Wh...
nodes.title: SUCCESS: Presence alerts working end-to-end. When a CCE session registers with the broker, all other connected sessions receive a JSON-RPC notification with method=presence, params={user, status=online/offline, timestamp}. Listener displays green/red circle emoji. Tested: registered user2, saw online alert; unregistered user2, saw offline alert.

nodes.label: SUCCESS: Built complete CCE-to-CCE direct messa...
nodes.title: SUCCESS: Built complete CCE-to-CCE direct messaging system with Unix domain sockets. Features: (1) Simple threaded broker daemon with JSON-RPC 2.0, (2) UnifiedDelivery - direct-first with Slack DM fallback, (3) Presence alerts - online/offline broadcast to all connected sessions, (4) @mention detection with regex extraction, (5) Zeus task watcher polling task_activity table every 30s, (6) Full ...

nodes.label: FAILED APPROACH: git reset HEAD to unstage pyca...
nodes.title: FAILED APPROACH: git reset HEAD to unstage pycache files alarmed user who thought work was being reverted. User warned: do not fuck up any of our work, do not revert to old shit. Resolution: Reset staging completely, then individually git add only the specific .py files by listing each one explicitly. Prevention: When staging files for commit, ALWAYS use explicit git add for each file rather th...

nodes.label: FAILED APPROACH: sudo password piping via echo ...
nodes.title: FAILED APPROACH: sudo password piping via echo pipe to sudo -S failed repeatedly (3 incorrect password attempts). The jkadmin password was not accepted through stdin pipe in Claude Code sandboxed bash. Resolution: Wrote updated file to /tmp/cce-updated, then user ran sudo cp manually. Prevention: For sudo operations, write to temp file and ask user to run the sudo command, or use a passwordless...

nodes.label: FAILED APPROACH: Async broker daemon (daemon.py...
nodes.title: FAILED APPROACH: Async broker daemon (daemon.py) did not respond to connections. The asyncio-based broker with complex event loops and abstract classes was unreliable. Resolution: Replaced with simple_daemon.py using threading + blocking sockets. Simple threaded approach with json.loads/json.dumps over Unix sockets proved far more reliable than asyncio for IPC broker. Prevention: For Unix socke...
